head.title: The Side Effects Of Surfing on the Job

hedline.hl1: The Side Effects Of Surfing on the Job

abstract.p: Survey commissioned by Pogo.com, an online games service, finds nearly 10 percent of 1,000 people surveyed say their work performance has suffered as a result of the time they spend online, while an additional 13 percent blame Internet for their inability to stay focused at work (M)

block.p: The cat is out of the bag: Your boss knows you use the Internet on the job to shop and to plan your next Club Med vacation. But how is all that surfing affecting your work?

A new survey has found that nearly 10 percent of employees with Internet access think that their work performance has suffered as a result of the time they spend online. An additional 13 percent blamed the Internet for their inability to stay focused at work. E-mail seems to be a distraction, too. Of the 1,000 people surveyed, 11 percent said they checked their e-mail up to 10 times a day.
The cat is out of the bag: Your boss knows you use the Internet on the job to shop and to plan your next Club Med vacation. But how is all that surfing affecting your work?

A new survey has found that nearly 10 percent of employees with Internet access think that their work performance has suffered as a result of the time they spend online. An additional 13 percent blamed the Internet for their inability to stay focused at work. E-mail seems to be a distraction, too. Of the 1,000 people surveyed, 11 percent said they checked their e-mail up to 10 times a day.

Of course, the vast majority of the respondents said the Internet did not negatively impact their work. Some people forgo a walk during their lunch breaks to use the Internet; 14 percent said they ate at their desks so they could log on.
Garth Chouteau, a spokesman for Pogo.com, an online games service that commissioned the survey, said the findings suggested that people ''need rest and relaxation while they are at work.''
''If someone is taking a 10-minute break to play solitaire, that may, in fact, be valuable.''
